channel.title: MySQL authentication
channel.description:
I have the following settings in place but am unable to log in with a new user account in the client. JSON can but not MySQL. [code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd"> <properties> <comment>MoparClassic-LS Config</comment> <entry key="mysqlhost">localhost</entry> <entry key="mysqldb">moparclassic</entry> <entry key="mysqluser">root</entry> <entry key="mysqlpass">password</entry> <entry key="lsip">localhost</entry> <entry key="lsport">34526</entry> <entry key="queryip">localhost</entry> <entry key="queryport">8186</entry> <entry key="storage-medium">org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL</entry> <entry key="auth-class">org.moparscape.msc.ls.auth.impl.PersistenceAuth</entry> <entry key="auth-meta-data"></entry> <entry key="allow-multilogging">true</entry> <entry key="cache-saves">true</entry> <entry key="use-reddit">false</entry> <entry key="auto-register">true</entry> </properties> [/code]
I attempted to copy an account in the players table from a RSCA/DarkQuest database and used a SHA-512 generator to find a hex hash for the pass column. The client gives the error message of invalid user or password. Is MySQL auth broken in MoparClassic right now? I did not see any mentions of a salt applied to the password hash in the code. Since the JSON storage engine logs in correctly, I know it is not the client.
I attempted to use reddit authentication with reddit.xml populated for a reddit account that I sent a message to for white listing as well as attempted to message the account listed in the subreddit topic. No luck. I would prefer to work with MySQL only for development purposes and not JSON or websiteauth.

item.title: MySQL authentication
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Yes but the creation of players and generating passwords is what I am having the problem with. SHA-512 passwords in the database are not being accepted for player passwords when logging in.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL authentication
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

cleako:

Has anyone tested MySQL player loading and saving with MoparClassic? If so, can a sample DB insert be provided so I can see what I’m doing wrong?

Yes and a database is provided on the github page.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL authentication
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:3, topic:530959”]Attempted to run the generator for the word “testing” and then and paste the hex hash result again in the generator for another hash and paste that into the database. No luck.[/quote]If you manually compare them, are they the same?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Attempted to run the generator for the word “testing” and then and paste the hex hash result again in the generator for another hash and paste that into the database. No luck.

item.title: MySQL authentication
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

It looks like the password is ran through SHA-512 before it’s sent to the server, then again once the server gets it.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL authentication
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

I have the following settings in place but am unable to log in with a new user account in the client. JSON can but not MySQL.

[code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

MoparClassic-LS Config localhost moparclassic root password localhost 34526 localhost 8186 org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL org.moparscape.msc.ls.auth.impl.PersistenceAuth true true false true [/code]

I attempted to copy an account in the players table from a RSCA/DarkQuest database and used a SHA-512 generator to find a hex hash for the pass column. The client gives the error message of invalid user or password. Is MySQL auth broken in MoparClassic right now? I did not see any mentions of a salt applied to the password hash in the code. Since the JSON storage engine logs in correctly, I know it is not the client.

I attempted to use reddit authentication with reddit.xml populated for a reddit account that I sent a message to for white listing as well as attempted to message the account listed in the subreddit topic. No luck. I would prefer to work with MySQL only for development purposes and not JSON or websiteauth.

Read full topic
